reviews.text: The Village Green in Bar Harbor is a lovely area right in the center of town. It has a great gazebo, easy access to tons of nearby shops and restaurants, beautiful foliage in the fall, and usually isn't too crowded, even during peak seasons. Great spot to relax!

Bus changed last bus leaves at 730pm. Why would you want to change the schedule until after Labor Day. There was alot of older people waiting for the bus after 730pm that could not make it to the place they were staying by walking . The local government should consider changing the date next year.     All said this is a beautiful part of our great nation everyone should see
Beautiful park to visit in Bar Harbor. Great views.

Nice, green (trees and grass), small park in the center(ish) of Bar Harbor. Has a good sized bike rack, so we had room for locking up our bikes after getting off the bus, so we could explore the town. The Village Green is the main bus station for catching the bus to the Visitor Center and buses for other routes on Mount Desert Island.
After you purchase an ice cream cone, a latte, or a book, you can enjoy your treat with a beautiful view from this park.

My kids enjoyed the ice cream, but they only accept cash and if you do not know this, someone will be a major B about it to you. Also, make sure to ask what flavors or where their non-dairy ice cream is at because an employee won't understand what you mean. I was very excited to see non-dairy ice cream but ended up getting any due to being spoken to the way I was and in turn my partner didn't want anything either. I didn't want my kids to suffer, but I didn't want to give them any more of my money.
Their vegan ice cream is the best I've ever had. Whenever I visit Bar Harbor I get a different flavor each day that I'm there.
Great little ice cream shop in the heart of Bar Harbor. Some interesting flavors, but the blueberry (what else?) was the favorite among our group. Outside seating was very inviting too.

As far as I'm concerned, this place is the Gold standard for what an ice cream parlor should be. The portions are huge, the flavors are myriad, and the price is well-within reason. Not to mention the staff who are eager to help and timely with their service. Try the ice cream sandwich made with chocolate chip cookies and make sure to bring a friend, you'll probably need their help to tackle it.

I've had ice cream in very many places on multiple continents, and CJ's is EASILY the best ice cream I've ever had.

The Black Raspberry Disaster is arguably the best flavor, but you cannot go wrong with what you pick.  Rare is it to find an ice cream place that makes you willing to drive multiple hours to get to, but CJ's is exactly that.

Highly recommended for your first day in town, your second, third, and every day thereafter.

Very unique flavors that are out of this world. Went here multiple times during our stay. Highly recommend getting ice cream here. It's also located right in the town center and there are plenty of benches/grassy areas at which to sit. Easy walking distance from the harbor.

Had some great blueberry ice cream at Mount Desert Island Ice Cream. Staff were very friendly, the store was spacious, and there was a good selection of flavors. Prices were a bit high, but reasonable. A line formed as we were checking out, so maybe plan on a bit of a wait!
Unique flavors that you will not find any where else. Some of them we told ourselves that we didn't like but still ate all of it. It is a great place to expand your palette.

Great ice cream and large scoops! A little out of the way from the main cluster of downtown shops, but worth the extra couple minute walk. I also love that they employ a lot of students/kids, providing them valuable job experience.
Fun place to visit. Very unique flavors. I had one with true fresh mint. Amazing. It is on a side street that can make it easy to miss but worth the stop.

Wow! Fantastic breakfast - so good, we went twice in two days and had the same thing each time. Delicious and plentiful corned beef hash, a huge breakfast sandwich, and perfectly plate-sized, crispy on the edges and gooey in the middle blueberry pancakes. Great, strong but not bitter, locally roasted coffee with quick refills. Very attentive and friendly service and the food comes out in minutes. Terrific stop to fuel up before or after hiking.

Nice spot to grab breakfast. There was a wait, so you know it's good. They gave us coffee and tea while we waited, and there was outdoor seating available while waiting. We ordered food and 5 minutes later it was there. Service was awesome, and they gave us free/real Maple syrup. Great taste, great service, friendly staff and great value! Would definitely go there again next time I'm in the area.
Thanks!

A great place to eat in Bar-Harbor. It has a very unique menu (not common) and the food and the service are excellent. I also liked the way the place is organized. Will definitely recommend to visit there if you are staying in Bar-Harbor.

It was crowded,  good places usually are. The host offered us coffee and muffins to make our wait pleasant.  We had breakfast, omelet and bagel plate. Excellent as was the service.  I recommend this highly.

Amazing food!! I'm so glad we came across this restaurant. Highly recommended. 
Our server was wonderful too. Overall, it was truly a 5 star experience.

Charming place. Great service. View outside of restaurant is nice if you get a window with a view. Food was delicious and decent portion size. I had the scallops with risotto and asparagus. Big wine selection.

A delightful dining experience! In fact, we dined here two nights in a row. Friendly, attentive waitstaff. Fresh, mouthwatering seafood and perfect cocktails. My husband and I were exceptionally pleased with Galyn's.

The team at Galyn"s was great and it's a beautiful location! Nice menu and cocktails. I reminded myself that I was in a very touristy area need to temper my expectations for great food and reasonable prices. Keeping that in mind, the food was decent, although not as delicious as I expected based on other reviews, and especially the prices.

Lovely location, fast service. Delicious food! 

Vegetarian options: several items available. The cauliflower steak was divine. 

The meat and seafood options were also great.

I came here with lowish expectations since Bar Harbor is a tourist town and tourist towns tend to have mediocre restaurants.  I was pleasantly surprised and actually had a great meal. I had the twin lobster tails and they were delicious.  My dad had the Halibut and he also enjoyed his meal. The service was awesome and our waiter was very kind and charismatic.  Definitely worth stopping here if you want a great meal.

Havana belongs on any foodie's "Note to Self" page during visits to Bar Harbor.  Innovative menu for vegans and meat-lovers alike (rare!) and an inviting wine list to boot.  That they remain open most of the year - even off season - adds to our delight in visiting.  Love this place.
Really lovely little restaurant with a friendly staff.  The food was very good and the beer selection decent.  Although they got both of my beer orders wrong I would definitely go back.

Excellent restaurant. Had the fish of the day and by far was the best fish I've ever had. Portion is a little small and wait times can be long, but it is what it is. A few other patrons had the tapas and they looked excellent as well. Would recommend.

Our experience at Havana is second to none. The service was incredible matched only by the food and drinks. Enrique our server was fantastic. I highly recommend the black bean soup, the empanadas and the farmhouse salad, and the Havana martini is tasty.  Thanks!!

Best paella I've ever eaten - generous helping of perfectly-cooked seafood and the saucy rice was just spot on. But everything we had was delicious anyway. The mashed potatoes with coconut that came with one of the daily specials was just... So good...

The wine list is nuts, apparently one of the largest in the region. They have the little notes in the wine menu to help you choose, and we were really happy with the bottle we had.

And of course, the service was excellent. They open at 5pm but it appears that the live music starts a little later.
